DataElement.preferredName: Heart Baseline Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Test Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value, in percentage, measuring the initial ejection fraction of the left ventricle of the heart while the patient is seated and at rest.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Heart Baseline Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the initial measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a baseline ejection fraction less than or equal to 50% as assessed by echocardiogram or MUGA

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of asymptomatic LVEF decline to less than 40% during or after prior HER2-targeted therapy?

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
